sentences.sContent: I used to have fantasies about living in Paris with an artist.
sentences.sCn: 我过去常幻想着在巴黎与一位艺术家同住。

sentences.sContent: Young children sometimes can’t distinguish between fantasy and reality.
sentences.sCn: 小孩子有时不能区分幻想与现实。

sentences.sContent: He lived in a fantasy world of his own, even as a small boy.
sentences.sCn: 甚至还是个小孩子的时候，他就生活在一个幻想世界里。

synos.tran: 耽于幻想；奏幻想曲（等于phantasy）

remMethod.val: “范特西”→听着周杰伦的《范特西》， 陷入无限的想象→ 幻想， 白日梦

words.tran: 奇异的；空想的；极好的；不可思议的
想像中地；奇特地；难以置信地
幻想曲；集成曲；幻想作品
幻想家；梦想家；脾气古怪的人

trans.tranOther: an exciting and unusual experience or situation you imagine happening to you, but which will probably never happen
